11003: If the words @deva[गुण] or @deva[वृद्धि] are used to denote the operation of  @deva[गुणादेश] or @deva[वृद्धि-आदेश] without specifying where such an @deva[आदेश] happens, then this @deva[आदेश] should be done in place of the '@deva[इक्]' letter.
11004: If a part of @deva[धातु] gets removed due to an @deva[आर्धधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय], then that @deva[प्रत्यय] cannot cause any  @deva[गुण] or @deva[वृद्धि] on the @deva[इक्] letter of the remaining part of that @deva[धातु].
11005: In presence of a @deva[कित्],  @deva[गित्] or a @deva[ङित्] @deva[प्रत्यय], any @deva[गुण] or @deva[वृद्धि] that might happen on an @deva[इक्]-letter of an @deva[अङ्ग] is prohibited.
11006: The @deva[इक्] letter of - (a) the verb @deva[दीधीङ्],  (b) The verb @deva[वेवीङ्] , and (c) @deva[इडागम] - do not undergo a @deva[गुण] or a @deva[वृद्धि].
11007: Group of two or more  @deva[व्यञ्जनानि] pronounced together without any @deva[स्वर] or a pause between them is referred as @deva[संयोग].
11008: A letter whose pronunciation needs the usage of nose as well as mouth is called an @deva[अनुनासिक].
11009: Two letters are called @deva[सवर्ण] of each other if their mouth-based location of pronunciation and their @deva[आभ्यन्तरप्रयत्न] are same as of each other.
11010: A @deva[स्वर] and a @deva[व्यञ्जन] cannot be @deva[सवर्ण] of each other.
11011: @deva[दीर्घ-ईकारान्त], @deva[दीर्घ-ऊकारान्त] and @deva[एकारान्त] forms of @deva[द्विवचन] are known as '@deva[प्रगृह्य]'.
11012: The forms of the @deva[अदस्] word which end in @deva[मी] / @deva[मू] / @deva[मे] are known as '@deva[प्रगृह्य]'.
11014: Except for the word @deva[आङ्], all other @deva[निपाताः] that contain only one @deva[स्वर] (and no @deva[व्यञ्जन]) are known as @deva[प्रगृह्य].
11016: According to Shakalya, the @deva[ओकार] at end of the @deva[सम्बोधन-एकवचन] form, when followed by the word '@deva[इति]' in a non vedic context, gets the term @deva[प्रगृह्य].
11017: According to Shakalya, the @deva[निपात] '@deva[उञ्]', when followed by the word '@deva[इति]' in a non vedic context, gets the term '@deva[प्रगृह्य]'.
11018: According to Shakalya, the '@deva[उञ्]' when followed by the @deva[अवैदिक]  '@deva[इति]' word  gets optionally converted to @deva[प्रगृह्य] @deva[ऊँ].
11019: An  @deva[ईकारान्त] and an @deva[ऊकारान्त] word that represents the meaning of @deva[सप्तमी] gets the term '@deva[प्रगृह्य]'.
11020: Except for the verbs @deva[दाप्] and @deva[दैप्], all other verbs that are referred to as '@deva[दारूपाः]' or '@deva[धारूपाः]' are known as '@deva[घु]'.
11021: If a word has a single letter, it acts as the first letter, and it also acts as the last letter.
11022: The @deva[तरप्] @deva[प्रत्यय] and the @deva[तमप्] @deva[प्रत्यय] are known as '@deva[घ]'
11023: The words @deva[बहु] and @deva[गण], and the words ending in the @deva[वतुँप्] and @deva[डति] @deva[प्रत्यय] are known as '@deva[संख्या]'.
11024: The @deva[षकारान्त] and the @deva[नकारान्त] words which are referred to as '@deva[संख्या]' are also called '@deva[षट्]'.
11025: The word ending in the @deva[डति] @deva[प्रत्यय] which is referred to as '@deva[संख्या]' is also called '@deva[षट्]'.
11027: The words belonging to the @deva[सर्वादिगण] are called @deva[सर्वनाम].
11028: The words of @deva[सर्वादिगण] in a @deva[दिशावाची] @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] are optionally considered @deva[सर्वनाम].
11029: The words of @deva[सर्वादिगण], when used to create a @deva[बहुव्रीहिसमास] are not called @deva[सर्वनाम].
11030: The words of the @deva[सर्वादिगण] participating in a @deva[तृतीयासमास] are not called @deva[सर्वनाम].
11031: The words formed by the @deva[द्वन्द्व] @deva[समास] of the words of @deva[सर्वादिगण] are not called @deva[सर्वनाम].
11032: The words formed by the @deva[द्वन्द्व] @deva[समास] of the words of @deva[सर्वादिगण] are optionally called @deva[सर्वनाम] when they get the '@deva[जस्]' pratyay.
11033: The words - @deva[प्रथम], @deva[चरम], @deva[अल्प], @deva[अर्ध], @deva[कतिपय], and @deva[नेम] ; and also the words ending in the '@deva[तयप्]' @deva[प्रत्यय] are optionally called @deva[सर्वनाम] when they get the '@deva[जस्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
11034: The words '@deva[पूर्व]', '@deva[पर]', '@deva[अवर]', '@deva[दक्षिण]', '@deva[उत्तर]', '@deva[अपर]' and '@deva[अधर]'; when used in the sense of 'limit' but not as a proper noun; are optionally called @deva[सर्वनाम] when followed by the @deva[जस्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
11035: The word '@deva[स्व]', when used in a meaning different than 'relatives' and 'money'  is optionally called @deva[सर्वनाम] when followed by the @deva[जस्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
11036: The word  '@deva[अन्तर]', when used in the meaning of 'outside a certain place' or 'undergarment', is optionally called '@deva[सर्वनाम]' when followed by the '@deva[जस्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
11037: The words of the @deva[स्वरादिगण] and the words which are called '@deva[निपात]' are all also known as '@deva[अव्यय]'.
11038: A @deva[तद्धितान्त] word to which all the @deva[विभक्तिप्रत्ययाः] cannot be attached is known as '@deva[अव्यय]'.
11039: A word that ends in - (a) a @deva[मकारान्त] @deva[कृत्-प्रत्यय],  or (b) a @deva[कृत्-प्रत्यय] that ends in the @deva[एच्] letter - is known as '@deva[अव्यय]'.
11040: The words ending in @deva[क्त्वा], @deva[तोसुन्] and @deva[कसुन्] @deva[प्रत्यय] are known as '@deva[अव्यय]'.
11041: The word formed using an @deva[अव्ययीभाव] @deva[समास] are known as @deva[अव्यय].
11043: The @deva[सुँ], @deva[औ], @deva[जस्], @deva[अम्], and @deva[औट्] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] attached to a non-@deva[नपुंसकलिङ्ग] word are called '@deva[सर्वनामस्थान]'.
11044: The word @deva[विभाषा] is used to indicate the meaning of 'optional negation' and 'optional application'.
11045: An '@deva[इक्]' letter that comes as a replacement for a '@deva[यण्]' letter is known as @deva[सम्प्रसारण].
11046: A @deva[टित्-आगम] is attached before its substrate, and a @deva[कित्-आगम] comes after its substrate.
11047: A @deva[मित्-आगम] is attached after the last @deva[स्वर] of its substrate.
11048: When an '@deva[एच्]' letter undergoes a @deva[हस्वादेश], it is replaced by an '@deva[इक्]' letter.
11049: When the @deva[षष्ठी] @deva[विभक्ति] occurring in a sutra does not indicate a clear relationship,  it is considered to indicate the @deva[स्थानी].
11050: Out of multiple @deva[आदेशाः] possible in a place, the one that is closest in properties gets selected.
11051: Any @deva[अ], @deva[आ], @deva[इ], @deva[ई], @deva[उ], @deva[ऊ] letter appearing as an @deva[आदेश] in place of a @deva[ऋकार]/@deva[ऌकार] is always followed by the letter @deva[र्]/@deva[ल्] respectively.
11052: @deva[आदेश] told in a sutra happens in the place of the last letter of the @deva[स्थानी].
11053: A @deva[ङित्-आदेश] happens to the last letter of the  @deva[स्थानी].
11054: The @deva[आदेश] told on the latter word of a given @deva[निमित्त] happens on its first letter.
11055: An @deva[आदेश] which either has more than one letters, or is @deva[शित्] - replaces the entire @deva[स्थानी].
11056: An @deva[आदेश] acts like a @deva[स्थानी] in the context of the operations that are not associated with a single letter.
11057: An @deva[आदेश] done in place of an @deva[अच्] letter due to the @deva[परनिमित्त] acts like the @deva[स्थानी] even in the context of @deva[कार्याणि] that are associated with a single letter; as long as the @deva[कार्याणि] are on an entity prior to the location of the @deva[स्थानी].
11058: An @deva[आदेश] done in place of an @deva[अच्] letter due to the @deva[परनिमित्त] never acts like a @deva[स्थानी]; even for the single-letter-@deva[कार्याणि] done on an entity prior to the location of the @deva[स्थानी]; in the context of -  (1) @deva[पदान्तकार्य]  (2) @deva[द्वित्वकार्य]  (3) '@deva[वरच्]' @deva[प्रत्ययकार्य] (4) @deva[यकारलोप]  (5) @deva[स्वरविधि] (6) @deva[सवर्णकार्य] (7) @deva[अनुस्वारविधि] (8) @deva[दीर्घादेशकार्य] (9) @deva[जश्त्वकार्य] and (10) @deva[चर्त्वकार्य].
11059: An @deva[आदेश] done in place of an @deva[अच्] letter acts like a @deva[स्थानी] for the @deva[द्वित्वकार्य], provided that such a @deva[द्वित्वकार्य] is caused by an @deva[अजादि] @deva[षनिमित्त].
11060: non-appearance of a letter or a group of letters is called @deva[लोप].
11061: The elision of a @deva[प्रत्यय] done using the specific words @deva[लुक्], @deva[श्लु] and @deva[लुप्] is respectively known by the terms @deva[लुक्], @deva[श्लु], @deva[लुप्].
11062: The @deva[कार्य] associated with a @deva[प्रत्यय] happens even when the @deva[प्रत्यय] undergoes a @deva[लोप].
11063: A @deva[प्रत्यय] that has been removed @deva[लुक्] , @deva[श्लु] or @deva[लुप्] does not cause any @deva[अङ्गकार्यम्].
11064: The fragment of a word starting from its last @deva[अच्] letter till the end is called @deva[टि].
11065: The second-last letter of a word is called @deva[उपधा].
11066: The words in the @deva[सप्तमी] @deva[विभक्ति] are used to indicate that the @deva[कार्य] happens on an immediately previous entity.
11067: The words in the @deva[पञ्चमी] @deva[विभक्ति] are used to indicate that the @deva[कार्य] happens on an immediately next entity.
11068: The words used in the rules of the grammar represent the verbatim sequence of the letters (and not their underlying meaning); except for the technical terms which represent the meaning rather than the verbatim sequence of the letters.
11069: An @deva[अण्] letter which does not represent an @deva[आदेश], and an @deva[उदित] letter (one of @deva[कु], @deva[चु], @deva[टु], @deva[तु], @deva[पु]) used in a sutra represent all the @deva[सवर्ण] forms.
11070: A letter that follows or is followed by '@deva[त्]' represents only those @deva[सवर्णाः] which require the same time for pronunciation as that letter.
11071: A beginning letter, when combined with an ending @deva[इत्] letter, stands for itself and for all the letters in between.
11072: A @deva[विधि] mentioned using an adjective happens in the context of that adjective, and also in context of the words which end in that adjective.
11073: A word whose first @deva[स्वर] is @deva[वृद्धि] is called '@deva[वृद्ध]'.
11074: The words of the @deva[त्यदादिगण] are called  '@deva[वृद्ध]'.
11075: A word that represent the name of an eastern country and whose first @deva[स्वर] is @deva[ए] or @deva[ओ] is called  '@deva[वृद्ध]'.
12001: The non-@deva[ञित्] and non-@deva[णित्]  @deva[प्रत्ययाः] attached to the - (1) the '@deva[गाङ्]' @deva[आदेश] (that happens to the @deva[धातु] '@deva[इङ्] @deva[अध्ययने]'), and (2) the verbs of the @deva[कुटादिगण] (an @deva[अन्तर्गण] of @deva[तुदादिगण]) - behave as if they are @deva[ङित्].
12002: A @deva[प्रत्यय] that gets an @deva[इडागम] is considered @deva[ङित्] when attached to the dhatu '@deva[विज्]'.
12005: For a verb root that does not end in a @deva[संयोग], the @deva[अपित्] @deva[प्रत्यय] of  @deva[लिट्-लकार] behaves like a @deva[कित्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
12027: Vowels are classified as @deva[ह्रस्व], @deva[दीर्घ] and @deva[प्लुत] based on the time taken for their pronunciation, as compared against the time of @deva[उ], @deva[ऊ] and @deva[उ]3 respectively.
12028: Action denoted by the words @deva[ह्रस्व] / @deva[दीर्घ] / @deva[प्लुत] happens in place of an @deva[अच्] letter.
12029: A vowel that is pronounced using the upper-half portion of its @deva[उच्चारणस्थान] is known as @deva[उदात्त].
12030: A vowel that is pronounced using the lower-half portion of its @deva[उच्चारणस्थान] is known as @deva[अनुदात्त].
12031: A vowel that is pronounced using the upper as well as lower portions of its @deva[उच्चारणस्थान] is known as  @deva[स्वरित].
12032: The first half part of a @deva[स्वरित-स्वर] is considered @deva[उदात्त].
12041: A @deva[प्रत्ययः] that contains only one letter is called @deva[अपृक्त] ।
12045: A meaningful word which is not a @deva[धातु], not a @deva[प्रत्यय], and which does not end in  @deva[प्रत्यय] is called a '@deva[प्रातिपदिक]'.
12046: @deva[कृत्-प्रत्ययान्त] words, @deva[तद्धितप्रत्ययान्त] words and the @deva[सामासिकशब्दाः] are known as @deva[प्रातिपदिक].
12047: The last letter of an @deva[अजन्त] @deva[प्रातिपदिक] is becomes @deva[हस्व] in context of @deva[नपुंसकलिङ्ग].
12064: If two or more words have identical forms for all @deva[विभक्ति]s, then in usage only one word is used by applying appropriate @deva[वचन] to it.
13001: The words @deva[भू] and others, when used to denote an action, are called '@deva[धातु]'.
13002: An @deva[अनुनासिक] @deva[स्वर] present in an @deva[उपदेश] is called '@deva[इत्]'.
13003: The ending @deva[हल्] letter of  an @deva[उपदेश] is called '@deva[इत्]'.
13004: The letters - @deva[त्], @deva[थ्], @deva[द्], @deva[ध्], @deva[न्], @deva[स्], @deva[म्] - occurring in the @deva[औपदेशिक] form of a @deva[विभक्ति] are not called '@deva[इत्]' ।
13005: The groups @deva[ञि], @deva[टु] and @deva[डु] occurring at the beginning of an @deva[उपदेश] are called '@deva[इत्]'.
13006: The letter @deva[ष्] at the beginning of the @deva[औपदेशिक] form of a @deva[प्रत्यय] is called '@deva[इत्]' ।
13007: The letters - @deva[च्], @deva[छ्], @deva[ज्], @deva[झ्], @deva[ञ्], @deva[ट्], @deva[ठ्], @deva[ड्], @deva[ढ्], @deva[ण्] -  at the beginning of the @deva[औपदेशिक] form of a @deva[प्रत्यय] are called @deva[इत्] ।
13008: The letters @deva[ल्], @deva[श्], @deva[क्], @deva[ख्], @deva[ग्], @deva[घ्], @deva[ङ्]  at the beginning of the @deva[औपदेशिक] form of a non-@deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] are called @deva[इत्] ।
13009: The @deva[इत्] letter is elided during the @deva[प्रक्रिया].
13010: When a certain relation is given between two groups having same number of elements, then the relation is considered to exist only between the correspondingly positioned members of the two groups.
13011: In this @deva[सूत्रपाठ], a @deva[स्वरित] @deva[स्वर] is used to denote @deva[अनुवृत्ति]s.
13012: A verb that contains (a) @deva[इत्संज्ञक] @deva[ङकारः], or (b) an @deva[इत्संज्ञक] @deva[अनुदात्त] @deva[स्वर] gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13013: A verb gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] in the @deva[भावे] and the @deva[कर्मणि] @deva[प्रयोग].
13014: A verb gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], even in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], in the context of @deva[व्यतिहार] (exchange of actions).
13015: The verbs indicating the action of - (a) movement,  or (2) violence - do not get the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], in the context of @deva[व्यतिहार] (exchange of actions).
13016: A verb does not get the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद]  in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], in the context of @deva[व्यतिहार] (exchange of actions) when either of the words '@deva[इतरेतर]' or '@deva[अन्योन्य]' is used to describe the situation.
13017: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[नि]' is attached to the verb '@deva[विश्]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13018: When any of the @deva[उपसर्ग]s - @deva[परि], @deva[वि], @deva[अव] - is attached to the verb '@deva[क्री]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13019: When any of the @deva[उपसर्ग]s -  @deva[वि] or  @deva[परा] - is attached to the verb '@deva[जि]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13020: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] @deva[आङ्] is attached to the verb '@deva[दा]'; it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], provided that the  meaning is something other than 'opening the mouth'.
13021: When any of the @deva[उपसर्ग]s - @deva[आङ्] , @deva[अनु], @deva[सम] or @deva[परि] - is attached to the verb '@deva[क्रीड्]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13022: When any of the @deva[उपसर्ग]s - @deva[सम्] , @deva[अव], @deva[प्र], @deva[वि] - is attached to the verb '@deva[स्था]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13023: The verb @deva[स्था] gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] when used in the meaning of - (a) Clearing explaining own opinion, and (b) Putting and end to a question / debate.
13024: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[उत्]' is attached to the verb '@deva[स्था]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], provided that the meaning is not 'moving upwards / standing up'.
13025: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[उप]' is attached to the verb '@deva[स्था]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided the meaning is 'to approach using the @deva[मन्त्र]s'.
13026: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[उप]' is attached to the verb '@deva[स्था]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided that the verb is used in an @deva[अकर्मक] sense.
13027: When either of the @deva[उपसर्ग]s  - '@deva[उत्]', '@deva[वि]' - is attached to the verb '@deva[तप्]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of '@deva[आत्मनेपद]' ; provided that the verb is used in an @deva[अकर्मक] sense.
13028: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[आङ्]' is attached to verbs @deva[यम्] /  @deva[हन्] , they get the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided that the verbs are used in an @deva[अकर्मक] sense.
13029: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[सम्]' is attached to any of the verbs -  @deva[गम्],  @deva[ऋच्छ्], @deva[प्रच्छ्], @deva[स्वर्], @deva[ऋ], @deva[श्रु], @deva[विद्] - they get the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided that the verbs are used in an @deva[अकर्मक] sense.
13030: When any of the @deva[उपसर्ग]s - @deva[नि], @deva[सम्], @deva[वि] - is attached to the verb '@deva[ह्वे]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13031: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[आङ्]' is attached to the verb '@deva[ह्वे]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of '@deva[आत्मनेपद]', provided the meaning is 'to complete / to wish to defeat'.
13032:
The verb @deva[कृ] gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], when used in the meanings of  - 
(1) @deva[गन्धनम्] - To backbite, 
(2) @deva[अवक्षेपणम्] - To defame, 
(3) @deva[सेवन्] -  To serve or help out 
(4) @deva[साहसिक्यम्] - To force someone to do something against their wish, To rape
(5) @deva[प्रतियत्न] -To make someone change their character, 
(6) @deva[प्रकथनम्] - To narrate, 
and
(7) @deva[उपयोग] - To bring in practice, to use.
13033: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[अधि]' is attached to the verb '@deva[कृ]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided that the meaning is 'to forgive / to obtain victory'.
13034: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[वि]' is attached to the verb '@deva[कृ]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided the meaning is 'to make sound / to pronounce'.
13035: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[वि]' is attached to the verb '@deva[कृ]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided that the verb is used in an @deva[अकर्मक] sense.
13036: The verb @deva[नी]  gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद]  ; when used in the meaning of - (1) @deva[सम्मानन], To respect in an appropriate way (2) @deva[उत्सञ्जन], To lift up, to toss (3) @deva[आचार्यकरण], To convert someone into a teacher (by imparting proper knowledge to them) (4) @deva[ज्ञान], To decide, fix upon (5) @deva[भृतिः], Employ someone by giving money (6) @deva[निगणन], To pay off, to give loan ;  and (7) @deva[व्यय], To spend.
13037: The verb '@deva[नी]' when used in the @deva[कर्तरि]  @deva[सकर्मकप्रयोग] gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], provided that the @deva[कर्मपद] does not represent either the body or a part of the body of an animal.
13038: The verb '@deva[क्रम्]' gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], when it is used in the meaning of - (1) @deva[वृत्तिः] , To progress without getting stuck  , (2) @deva[सर्गः], enthusiasm, (3) @deva[तायनः], expansion, elaboration.
13039: When the verb '@deva[क्रम्]' comes with an @deva[उपसर्ग], it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] only in the meaning of - (1) @deva[वृत्तिः] , To progress without getting stuck  , (2) @deva[सर्गः], enthusiasm, (3) @deva[तायनः], expansion, elaboration.
13040: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[आङ्]' is attached to the verb '@deva[क्रम्]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], provided the meaning is 'to rise, to travel upwards'.
13041: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[वि]' is attached to the verb '@deva[क्रम्]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद], provided the meaning is 'to roam around with feet'.
13042: When the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[प्र]' or '@deva[उप]' is attached to the verb '@deva[क्रम्]', it gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] ; provided that the meaning expressed is 'the beginning of'.
13043: When the verb @deva[क्रम्] is used without any @deva[उपसर्ग], it optionally gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
13063: When the verb root @deva[कृ] is used after the @deva[आम्] @deva[प्रत्यय], the verb root @deva[कृ] gets the same @deva[पद] as the original verb to which the @deva[आम्] @deva[प्रत्यय] has been attached.
13072: A verb that contains @deva[इत्संज्ञक] @deva[ञकार] or an @deva[इत्संज्ञक] @deva[स्वरित] @deva[स्वरः] gets the @deva[प्रत्यया] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] when the doer of the action does the action for himself.
13078: The verbs that do not get the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आत्मनेपद] will get the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[परस्मैपद].
14001: If a word is given two @deva[संज्ञा]s  under this @deva[अधिकार], and if the @deva[संज्ञा] given by the later sutra can only be given whenever the @deva[संज्ञा] given by the earlier sutra is given, then under such circumstances, the word gets only the @deva[संज्ञा] given by the later sutra, not the earlier sutra.
14002: If two sutras that can be invoked independent of each other happen to conflict at the same step during a @deva[प्रक्रिया], then the later occurring sutra gets applied by precedence.
14003: The @deva[दीर्घ-ईकारान्त] and @deva[दीर्घ-ऊकारान्त] words which are only used as @deva[स्त्रीलिङ्ग] forms get the term '@deva[नदी]'.
14004: Except for the word '@deva[स्त्री]', any other word which is eligible for getting an @deva[इयङ्-आदेश] or an @deva[उवङ्-आदेश] is not referred to as @deva[नदी].
14005: Except for the word '@deva[स्त्री]', any other word which is eligible for getting an @deva[इयङ्-आदेश] or an @deva[उवङ्-आदेश] optionally gets the term @deva[नदी] in presence of the @deva[आम्] @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[षष्ठी] @deva[बहुवचन].
14006: Except for the word '@deva[स्त्री]', any other word which is eligible for getting an @deva[इयङ्-आदेश] or an @deva[उवङ्-आदेश], and any @deva[ह्रस्व-इकारान्त]/@deva[हस्व-उकारान्त] word optionally gets the term @deva[नदी] in presence of a @deva[ङित्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
14007: Except for the word @deva[सखि], all @deva[ह्रस्व-इकारान्त] and @deva[ह्रस्व-उकारान्त] words get the term @deva[घि] whenever they do not get the term @deva[नदी].
14008: The word @deva[पति] gets the term @deva[घि] only when used in a @deva[समास].
14009: The word @deva[पति], when associated with a word of @deva[षष्ठी] @deva[विभक्ति], optionally gets the term @deva[घि] in @deva[वेदाः].
14011: A @deva[ह्रस्व] @deva[स्वर] which is followed by a @deva[संयोग] gets the term @deva[गुरु].
14013: When a @deva[प्रत्यय] is attached to a word, everything that begins with the first letter of that word up to (and excluding) the first letter of the @deva[प्रत्ययः] itself, is called the an @deva[अङ्गम्] of that @deva[प्रत्यय].
14014: Any word ending in a @deva[सुप्] @deva[प्रत्यय] or a @deva[तिङ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is called a @deva[पद].
14015: A @deva[नकारान्त] word gets the term '@deva[पद]' when followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] that begins with @deva[क्य].
14016: In presence of a @deva[प्रत्यय] having @deva[सकार] as @deva[इत्संज्ञक], the @deva[प्रकृति] gets the term @deva[पद].
14017: If a @deva[प्रत्यय] which is not a @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] and which is specified in the fourth or fifth chapter gets attached to an @deva[प्रकृति] , the @deva[प्रकृति] gets the term @deva[पद].
14018: If a @deva[यकारादि] or an @deva[अजादि] @deva[प्रत्यय] which is not a @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] and which is specified in the fourth or fifth chapter gets attached to a @deva[प्रकृति] , the @deva[प्रकृति] gets the term @deva[भ].
14019: A @deva[तकारान्त] or a @deva[सकारान्त] word gets the term '@deva[भ]' when followed by a  @deva[मत्वर्थीय] @deva[प्रत्यय].
14020: The '@deva[अयस्मय]' and other words should be considered valid words in the @deva[वैदिक] literature.
14021: For referring to many, the @deva[बहुवचन] forms are used.
14022: For referring to two, the @deva[द्विवचन] forms are used, where as for referring to one, the @deva[एकवचन] forms are used.
14052: For verbs indicating motion (@deva[गति]), knowledge (@deva[बुद्धि]), eating (@deva[भक्षण]); for verbs whose action involves a word (@deva[शब्दकर्म]) ; and for the @deva[अकर्मक] verbs the  @deva[कर्ता] of the @deva[अप्रयोजक] sentence becomes @deva[कर्म] in the @deva[प्रयोजक] sentence.
14056: The words discussed till <<@deva[अधिरीश्वरे]>> @ref[1.4.97] are known as @deva[निपात].
14057: The words included in the @deva[चादिगण] are called @deva[निपात] when used in a sense that does not denote an object.
14058: The words included in the @deva[प्रादिगण] are called @deva[निपात] when used in a sense that does not denote an object.
14059: The words belonging to the @deva[प्रादिगण] are called @deva[उपसर्ग]  when used along with a verb.
14060: The words belonging to the @deva[प्रादिगण] are also called @deva[गति] when used along with a verb.
14080: Words referred as @deva[उपसर्ग] or @deva[गति] are attached before the verb root.
14099: The @deva[आदेशा] that occur in place of a @deva[लकार] are known as @deva[परस्मैपद].
14100: The @deva[तङ्], @deva[शानच्] and @deva[कानच्] @deva[आदेशाः] that occur in place of a @deva[लकार] are known as @deva[आत्मनेपद].
14101: The @deva[तिङ्-प्रत्ययाः], when grouped into groups of three, are sequentially known as @deva[प्रथम], @deva[मध्यम] and @deva[उत्तम].
14102: The @deva[तिङ्-प्रत्ययाः] are sequentially referred as @deva[एकवचन], @deva[द्विवचन] and @deva[बहुवचन].
14103: The @deva[सुप्-प्रत्ययाः] are sequentially referred as @deva[एकवचन], @deva[द्विवचन] and @deva[बहुवचन].
14105: Where a form of the word  @deva[युष्मद्] shows the same substance which is shown by the @deva[लकार], there the @deva[तिङन्तपद] must be expressed using the @deva[मध्यमपुरुष] @deva[प्रत्यया]s.
14106: When one person wants to make fun of what other person thinks, and he uses the verb '@deva[मन्]' to indicate the thinking process, the verb @deva[मन्] is used in @deva[उत्तमपुरुष-एकवचन] and the other verb is used in  @deva[मध्यमपुरुष]. For example, consider this statement - 'Do you think you can eat the rice' (@deva[एहि] @deva[मन्ये] @deva[ओदनम्] @deva[भोक्ष्यसे])? Here the speaker is making fun of the thinking process of other person, saying that the other person is thinking he could eat the rice, but he would not be able to. In such a case, the verb @deva[मन्] would get @deva[उत्तमपुरुष] (instead of ideally getting @deva[मध्यमपुरुष]), and the other word  (@deva[भुज्] in this case) would get @deva[मध्यमपुरुष] instead of ideally getting @deva[उत्तमपुरुष]). So, instead of saying  @deva[रे] @deva[बुभुक्षित], @deva[किम्] @deva[त्वं] @deva[एतत्] @deva[मन्यसे] @deva[यत्] @deva[अहम्] @deva[ओदनम्] @deva[भोक्ष्ये], we would say - @deva[एहि] @deva[मन्ये] @deva[ओदनम्] @deva[भोक्ष्यसे]?
14107: Where a form of the word @deva[अस्मद्] shows the same substance which is shown by the @deva[लकार], there the @deva[तिङन्तपद] must be expressed using the @deva[उत्तमपुरुष] @deva[प्रत्यया]s.
14108: Where a form of the word other than @deva[अस्मद्] or @deva[युष्मद्] shows the same substance which is shown by the @deva[लकार], there the @deva[तिङन्तपद] must be expressed using the @deva[प्रथमपुरुष] @deva[प्रत्यया]s.
14109: Extreme closeness of letters is called @deva[संहिता].
21001: The '@deva[पदविधि]' given in the @deva[व्याकरणशास्त्र] happens only for the words that exhibit @deva[सामर्थ्य] (that is, those which are related to each other).
21002: A @deva[सुबन्त] that is followed by an @deva[आमन्त्रित] will behave exactly like the @deva[अङ्ग] of that @deva[आमन्त्रित],when it comes to determination of the @deva[स्वर] in that @deva[सुबन्त].
21003: The @deva[समास] term is discussed from this sutra onwards till the end of second @deva[पाद] of the second chapter.
21004: A @deva[समास] is formed when one @deva[सुबन्त] combines with another related @deva[सुबन्त].
21006: An @deva[अव्यय] that is used in any of these meanings- @deva[विभक्तिः] (e.g. '@deva[अधि]'), @deva[समीपम्] (near, e.g. '@deva[उप]'), @deva[समृद्धिः] (prosperity, e.g. '@deva[सु]') , @deva[व्यृद्धिः] (deterioration, e.g. '@deva[दुस्]','@deva[दुर्]'), @deva[अर्थाभावः] (absence, e.g '@deva[निर्]'), @deva[अत्ययम्] (expiry, e.g. '@deva[अति]'), @deva[असम्प्रतिः] (non-presence, e.g. '@deva[अति]'), @deva[शब्दप्रादुर्भावः] (appearance of the word, e.g. '@deva[तत्]'), @deva[पश्चात्] (later, e.g. '@deva[अनु]'), @deva[यथा] (eligibility, e.g. '@deva[यथा]'), @deva[आनुपूर्व्य] (sequentially, e.g. '@deva[अनु]'), @deva[यौगपद्य] (simultaneously, e.g. '@deva[स]'), @deva[सादृश्य] (similarity, e.g. '@deva[स]'), @deva[सम्पत्ति] (appropriate, e.g. '@deva[स]'), @deva[साकल्यार्थः] (entirety, e.g. '@deva[स]'), @deva[अन्तवचनम्] ('till', e.g. '@deva[स]') - undergoes a @deva[समास] with a related @deva[सुबन्त], and the @deva[समास] is called @deva[अव्ययीभावसमास].
21007: The word '@deva[यथा]', when used in a meaning different than 'similarity', undergoes a @deva[समास] with a related @deva[सुबन्त], and the @deva[समास] is called @deva[अव्ययीभावसमास].
21008: When the word '@deva[यावत्]' is used in the the meaning of @deva[अवधारणा] (indication of a number, For example - 'as many'), it undergoes a @deva[समास] with a related @deva[सुबन्त], and the @deva[समास] is called @deva[अव्ययीभावसमास].
21009: The word '@deva[प्रति]' when used in the meaning of '@deva[मात्रा]' (little, a small amount) undergoes a @deva[समास] with related @deva[सुबन्त], and the @deva[समास] is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव].
21010: The word @deva[अक्ष] (dice), the word @deva[शलाका] (stick) and the words indicating a number - all undergo a @deva[समास] with a related '@deva[परि]' @deva[शब्द], and the @deva[समास] is called @deva[अव्ययीभावसमास].
21011: All the @deva[समासाः] that are told henceforth (in the following sutras) happen optionally.
21012: The words '@deva[अप]', '@deva[परि]', '@deva[बहि]' and the words generated from the verb '@deva[अञ्च्]' (E.g. @deva[प्राच्], @deva[प्रत्यच्], @deva[उदच्] etc) optionally undergo a @deva[समास] with related @deva[पञ्चम्यन्त] word; and the @deva[समास] is called @deva[अव्ययीभावसमास].
21013: The word '@deva[आङ्]' used in the meaning of @deva[मर्यादा] (exclusive limit) and @deva[अभिविधि] (inclusive limit) optionally undergoes a @deva[समास] with a related word in @deva[पञ्चमी], and the @deva[समास] is called @deva[अव्ययीभावसमास].
23049: The @deva[प्रथमा-एकवचन] when used in the context of  @deva[सम्बोधन] gets the term  '@deva[सम्बुद्धि]'.
24071: A @deva[सुप्] @deva[प्रत्यय] that comes as a part of a @deva[धातु] or a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] is removed.
24077: For the verb roots @deva[गा], @deva[स्था], @deva[पा], @deva[भू] and the verb roots referred as  '@deva[घु]', the @deva[सिच्-विकरण] is removed when followed by the  @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[परस्मैपद].
24078: For the verbs @deva[घ्रा], @deva[धेट्], @deva[शो], @deva[छो] and @deva[सो], the @deva[सिच्-प्रत्यय] is removed optionally when followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[परस्मैपद].
24081: The @deva[लकार] that follows the '@deva[आम्]' @deva[प्रत्यय] is removed.
24082: The @deva[आप्-प्रत्ययाः] and the @deva[सुप्-प्रत्ययाः] attached to an @deva[अव्यय] are removed by doing a @deva[लुक्].
24085: The @deva[प्रथमपुरुष] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[लुट्-लकार] are converted respectively to @deva[डा], @deva[रौ] and @deva[रस्].
31001: Everything told in this @deva[अधिकार] are known as @deva[प्रत्ययाः].
31002: All the words told in this @deva[अधिकार] are to be attached at the end of the @deva[प्रकृति].
31003: The first @deva[स्वर] of all the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] mentioned in this @deva[अधिकार] becomes @deva[उदात्त].
31004: The first letter of the @deva[सुप्] and the @deva[पित्] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] is @deva[अनुदात्त].
31032: The words ending in a @deva[सनादि] @deva[प्रत्यय] are called '@deva[धातु]'.

31046: When used with the meaning of 'giving a hug', The @deva[च्लि-प्रत्यय] that follows the verb root @deva[श्लिष्] is converted to @deva[क्स].
31047: For the verb root @deva[दृश्], @deva[च्लि] is not converted to @deva[क्स].

31049: For the verbs @deva[धेट्] and @deva[श्वि] , the @deva[च्लि] @deva[प्रत्यय] is optionally converted to @deva[चङ्].
31052: For the verbs @deva[असुँ] (@deva[क्षेपणे]), @deva[वच्], and @deva[ख्या], the @deva[च्लि-प्रत्यय] is converted to @deva[अङ्].
31053: For the verb roots @deva[लिप्] , @deva[सिच्] and @deva[ह्वे] , the @deva[च्लि-प्रत्यय] is converted to @deva[अङ्].
31054: For the verb roots @deva[लिप्] , @deva[सिच्] and @deva[ह्वे] , the @deva[च्लि-प्रत्यय] is optionally converted to @deva[अङ्] when followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[आत्मनेपद].
31055: For the verbs of @deva[पुषादिगण] and @deva[द्युतादिगण], as well as for the @deva[ऌदित] verbs, @deva[च्लि] is converted to @deva[अङ्] when followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[परस्मैपद].
31056: For the verbs @deva[सृ], @deva[शास्] and @deva[ऋ], the @deva[च्लि-प्रत्यय] is converted to @deva[अङ्].
31057: For the @deva[इरित्]-verbs, the @deva[च्लि] @deva[प्रत्यय] is optionally converted to @deva[अङ्].
31058: For the verbs @deva[जॄ], @deva[स्तन्भ्], @deva[म्रुच्], @deva[म्लुच्], @deva[ग्रुच्], @deva[ग्लुच्], @deva[ग्लुञ्च्],  @deva[टुओश्वि] - the  @deva[च्लि-प्रत्यय] is  optionally converted to  @deva[अङ्].
31067: In the @deva[कर्मणि] and the @deva[प्रयोगे] @deva[भावे] @deva[प्रयोग], @deva[धातु] gets '@deva[यक्]' @deva[प्रत्यय] when followed by a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय].
31068: A verb gets the @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय] '@deva[शप्]' in presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग].
31069: A verb belonging to the @deva[दिवादिगण] gets the @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय] '@deva[श्यन्]' in presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग].
31070: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verbs @deva[भ्राश्] , @deva[भ्लाश्], @deva[भ्रम्], @deva[क्रम्], @deva[क्लम्], @deva[त्रस्], @deva[त्रुट्], @deva[लष्]  get the  @deva[श्यन्] @deva[विकरण] optionally.
31071: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verb  @deva[यस्] when used without an @deva[उपसर्ग] gets the @deva[श्यन्] @deva[विकरण] optionally.
31072: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verb @deva[यस्] when used with the @deva[उपसर्ग] '@deva[सम्]' gets the @deva[श्यन्] @deva[विकरण] optionally.
31073: A verb belonging to the @deva[स्वादिगण] gets the @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय] '@deva[श्नु]' in presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग].
31074: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verb @deva[श्रु] is converted to @deva[शृ] and it gets the @deva[श्नु] @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय].
31075: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verb @deva[अक्ष्]  gets the @deva[श्नु] @deva[विकरण] optionally.
31076: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verb @deva[तक्ष्]  with the meaning 'to peel off / to scrape off' gets the @deva[श्नु] @deva[विकरण] optionally.
31077: A verb belonging to the @deva[तुदादिगण] gets the @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय] '@deva[श]' in presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग].
31078: A verb belonging to the @deva[रुधादिगण] gets the @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय] '@deva[श्नम्]' in presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग].
31079: A verb belonging to the @deva[तनादिगण] gets the @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय] '@deva[उ]' in presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग].
31080: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verbs @deva[धिन्व्], @deva[कृण्व्] gets the '@deva[उ]' @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय].
31081: A verb belonging to the @deva[क्र्यादिगण] gets the @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय] '@deva[श्ना]' in presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग].
31082: In presence of a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[प्रयोग], the verbs  @deva[स्तम्भ्], @deva[स्तुम्भ्], @deva[स्कम्भ्], @deva[स्कुम्भ्], @deva[स्कुञ्] gets the @deva[श्ना] or the @deva[श्नु] @deva[विकरणप्रत्यय].
31083: The @deva[श्ना] @deva[प्रत्यय] following a @deva[हल्] letter is converted to @deva[शानच्] when followed by the '@deva[हि]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
31084: The @deva[श्ना] @deva[प्रत्यय] following a @deva[हल्] letter is seen converted either to @deva[शायच्] or @deva[शानच्] when followed by the '@deva[हि]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
31085: In the context of @deva[वेदाः] - Some kind of irregularity might be seen with reference to application of @deva[विकरणप्रत्ययाः]
31086: In the context of @deva[वेदाः] - The @deva[सार्वधातुक] forms of @deva[आशीर्लिङ्गलकार] can also use @deva[अङ्] as @deva[गणविकरणप्रत्यय].
31092: The words referenced by the @deva[सप्तमीस्थ] words of the sutras in this @deva[धात्वधिकार] get the term '@deva[उपपद]'.
32059: The words - @deva[ऋत्विक्], @deva[दधृष्], @deva[स्रज्] , @deva[दिश्], @deva[उष्णिह्] - are considered to be readymade forms made using the @deva[क्विन्] @deva[प्रत्यय]. Also, the verb @deva[अञ्च्] gets the @deva[क्विन्] @deva[प्रत्यय] in presence of an @deva[उपपद], where as the verbs @deva[युज्] and  @deva[क्रुञ्च्] get the @deva[क्विन्] @deva[प्रत्यय] in absence of an @deva[उपपद].
32110: The @deva[लुङ्-प्रत्ययः] is used to indicate the past tense.
32111: @deva[लङ्-लकार] is used to indicate actions that have happened yesterday or before.
32115: @deva[लिट्-लकार] is used to indicate an action which was done yesterday or before and which was not seen by the speaker of the sentence.
32124: The @deva[लट्-लकार] gets @deva[शतृ] and @deva[शानच्] as @deva[आदेशाः] to denote the present-tense, provided a @deva[विभक्ति] other than @deva[प्रथमा] is used along with these.
33013: When a helper action is done for doing a main action in future (For example, 'going to school  for studying'), the @deva[लृट्लकार] can be used to denote the main action ('studying' in this example). In addition, the @deva[लृट्लकार] can also be used to indicate a general action to be done in future, even when no helper action is indicated.
33015: @deva[लुट्-लकार] is used to indicate actions that will happen tomorrow or later.
33139: In the context of future, if the cause-effect scenario is being described with an implication that the action did not happen, the @deva[लृङ्लकारः] is used.
33161: @deva[लिङ्लकार]  can be used to indicate @deva[विधि] (= order) , @deva[निमन्त्रण] ( = an invitation that cannot be rejected), @deva[आमन्त्रण]  (= an invitation that can be rejected), @deva[अधीष्ट] (= Ask something with respect, often in exchange of money or something else), @deva[सम्प्रश्न] (= A question about doing or not doing something) and @deva[प्रार्थना] (= request).
33162: @deva[लोट्लकार] can be used to indicate @deva[विधि] (= order) , @deva[निमन्त्रण] ( = an invitation that cannot be rejected), @deva[आमन्त्रण] (= an invitation that can be rejected), @deva[अधीष्ट] (= Ask something with respect, often in exchange of money or something else), @deva[सम्प्रश्न] (= A question about doing or not doing something) and @deva[प्रार्थना] (= request).
33173: @deva[लिङ्लकार] and @deva[लोट्लकार] are used to express the desire of something that cannot be easily attained.
33175: In presence of the @deva[अव्यय] @deva[माङ्], @deva[लुङ्लकारः] is used.
33176: When @deva[माङ्] is followed by @deva[स्म], the verb @deva[लुङ्लकार] or @deva[लङ्लकार] is used.
34069: For the @deva[सकर्मक] verb roots, the @deva[लकार] can be used in the @deva[कर्तरि] as well as the @deva[कर्मणि] sense. For the @deva[अकर्मक] verb roots, the @deva[लकार] can be used in @deva[कर्तरि] as well as @deva[भावे] sense.
34077: All the @deva[आदेश]s mentioned in this @deva[अधिकार] happen in place of  @deva[लकार]s.
34078: A @deva[लकार] is initially converted to one of these 18 @deva[आदेशाः] - @deva[तिप्], @deva[तस्], @deva[झि], @deva[सिप्], @deva[थस्], @deva[थ], @deva[मिप्], @deva[वस्], @deva[मस्], @deva[त], @deva[आताम्], @deva[झ], @deva[थास्], @deva[आथाम्], @deva[ध्वम्], @deva[इड्], @deva[वहि], @deva[महिङ्].
34079: In case of @deva[टित्-लकार]s, the '@deva[टि]' of the @deva[आत्मनेपद] @deva[प्रत्यय]s is converted to '@deva[ए]'.
34080: In case of @deva[टित्-लकार]s, the @deva[आत्मनेपद] @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[थास्] is converted to '@deva[से]'.
34081: In case of @deva[आत्मनेपद] of @deva[लिट्-लकार], the @deva[त-प्रत्यय] is converted to @deva[एश्] and  @deva[झ] @deva[प्रत्यय] is converted to @deva[इरेच्].
34082: In case of the @deva[लिट्] @deva[लकार], the @deva[परस्मैपद] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] are respectively converted to - @deva[णल्],@deva[अतुस्], @deva[उस्], @deva[थल्], @deva[अथुस्], @deva[अ], @deva[णल्], @deva[व], @deva[म].
34083: For the verb @deva[विद्], the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[लिट्लकार] are optionally converted (respectively) to @deva[णल्],@deva[अतुस्], @deva[उस्], @deva[थल्], @deva[अथुस्], @deva[अ], @deva[णल्], @deva[व], @deva[म].
34084: In case of the verb @deva[ब्रू], the first five @deva[परस्मैपद-प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[लट्लकार] are converted optionally to (respectively) @deva[णल्], @deva[अतुस्], @deva[उस्], @deva[थल्], and @deva[अथुस्]. Also, when this happens, the verb '@deva[ब्रू]' is converted to '@deva[आह्]'.
34085: The @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of the @deva[लोट्-लकार] are derived in the same way as that of the @deva[लङ्लकार].
34086: The @deva[इकार] present in the  @deva[प्रत्यया]s of @deva[लोट्लकार] is converted to @deva[उकार].
34087: The @deva[सिप्-प्रत्यय] of the @deva[लोट्-लकार] is converted to '@deva[हि]'.
34088: In the context of @deva[वेदाः], the '@deva[हि]' @deva[आदेश] given to the @deva[सिप्-प्रत्यय] of @deva[लोट्-लकार] could be seen considered as @deva[पित्].
34089: In the context of @deva[लोट्लकार], the @deva[मिप्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is converted to @deva[नि].
34090: An @deva[एकार] present in the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[लोट्-लकार] is converted to @deva[आम्].
34091: An @deva[एकार] coming after a  @deva[सकार]  or a  @deva[वकार] of @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[लोट्लकार] is respectively converted to @deva[व] and @deva[अम्].
34092: The @deva[उत्तमपुरुष] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[लोट्-लकार] get the @deva[आट्-आगम], and this @deva[आगम] is considered @deva[पित्].
34093: The @deva[एकार] occurring in the @deva[उत्तमपुरुष] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[लोट्-लकार] is converted to @deva[ऐ].
34099: In case of @deva[ङित्] @deva[लकार]s, the ending @deva[सकार] of the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[उत्तमपुरुष] is removed.
34100: In case of @deva[ङित्] @deva[लकार]s, The @deva[इकार] present in the @deva[परस्मैपद-प्रत्यय]s is removed.
34101: In case of @deva[ङित्-लकार]s, @deva[तस्], @deva[थस्], @deva[थ] and @deva[मिप्] are converted respectively to  @deva[ताम्], @deva[तम्], @deva[त] and @deva[अम्].
34103: The @deva[परस्मैपदस्य] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[लिङ्लकार] get a '@deva[यासुट्]' @deva[आगम] which is both - @deva[उदात्त] and @deva[ङित्].
34104: The @deva[परस्मैपदस्य] @deva[प्रत्ययाः] of @deva[आशीर्लिङ्लकार] get a '@deva[यासुट्]' @deva[आगम] which is both - @deva[उदात्त] and @deva[कित्].
34107: In case of @deva[लिङ्लकार], the @deva[तकार] and @deva[थकार] present in the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] get the '@deva[सुट्]' @deva[आगम].
34109: The @deva[झि-प्रत्यय] of a @deva[ङित्-लकार] that follows @deva[सिच्], @deva[अभ्यस्त] or the verb root @deva[विद्] is converted  to @deva[जुस्].
34110: For an @deva[आकारान्त] @deva[अङ्ग], even  when the @deva[सिच्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is removed, the @deva[झि-प्रत्यय] of a @deva[ङित्-लकार] is converted to @deva[जुस्].
34114: Except for @deva[तिङ्] and @deva[शित्] @deva[प्रत्यय]s, other @deva[प्रत्यय]s that are attached to verbs are called '@deva[आर्धधातुक]'.
34115: The @deva[तिङ्-प्रत्यय]s of the @deva[लिट्-लकार] get the term @deva[आर्धधातुक].
41001: This is an @deva[अधिकार], and all the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] told in this @deva[अधिकार] are to be applied to @deva[ङ्यन्त], @deva[आबन्त] and @deva[प्रातिपदिक] words.
41002: The @deva[प्रत्ययाः] - @deva[सुँ-औ-जस्-अम्-औट्-शस्-टा-भ्याम्-भिस्-ङे-भ्याम्-भ्यस्-ङसिँ-भ्याम्-भ्यस्-ङस्-ओस्-आम्-ङि-ओस्-सुप्] get attached to a word that ends in @deva[ङीप्]/@deva[ङीष्]/@deva[ङीन्]/@deva[टाप्]/@deva[डाप्]/@deva[चाप्] pratyay, or is a @deva[प्रातिपदिक].
41003: This is an @deva[अधिकार] which spans from the current sutra till (and just before) । @deva[समर्थानां] @deva[प्रथमाद्] @deva[वा]' 4.1.82.
41004: To indicate the feminine property, the @deva[अकारान्त] words and the words belonging to the @deva[अजादिगण] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[टाप्].
41005: To indicate the feminine property, the @deva[ऋकारान्त] and the @deva[नकारान्त] words get the @deva[ङीप्-प्रत्यय].
41006: @deva[प्रातिपदिकानि] which end with @deva[इत्संज्ञक] @deva[उक्] letter get the @deva[ङीप्-प्रत्यय] to indicate the feminine property.
41010: The words that get the term '@deva[षट्]', and the words @deva[स्वसृ], @deva[तिसृ], @deva[चतसृ], @deva[ननान्दृ], @deva[दुहितृ], @deva[यातृ], @deva[मातृ] do not get the   @deva[ङीप्-प्रत्यय] to indicate the feminine property.
41076: The @deva[प्रत्ययाः] that are being told from now onwards up to end of the fifth chapter are called @deva[तद्धितप्रत्ययाः].
41077: To indicate the feminine property, the, word @deva[युवन्] which is not an gets @deva[उपसर्जनसंज्ञक] the @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] '@deva[ति]'.
41082: The word indicated by the first @deva[समर्थ] present in the @deva[अर्थज्ञापकसूत्र] gets the  @deva[तद्धितप्रत्ययः] optionally.
41083: The @deva[अण्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used as a default for the @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतीय] meanings.
41084: The words of the @deva[अश्वपत्यादि] @deva[गण] get the @deva[अण्] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतीय] meaning.
41085: The words @deva[दिति], @deva[अदिति], @deva[आदित्य] and the words that end in '@deva[पति]' get the @deva[ण्य] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the  @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतीय] meanings.
41086: For the words of the @deva[उत्सादिगण], the @deva[अण्-प्रत्ययः] is used in all the  @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतीय] meanings.
41087: For the meanings given till the end of the first @deva[पाद] of the @deva[पञ्चमाध्याय], the word  @deva[स्त्री] gets the  @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[नञ्], and the word @deva[पुम्स्] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[स्नञ्].
41088: In case of a @deva[द्विगु-समास] that gets created in context of a @deva[तद्धितार्थ], the @deva[अजादि] @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] involved in this @deva[समास] is removed.
41092: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the word in the @deva[षष्ठी] @deva[विभक्ति] gets an appropriate @deva[प्रत्यय].
41095: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', an @deva[अदन्त] word in the @deva[षष्ठी] @deva[विभक्ति] gets the '@deva[इञ्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
41096: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring',  the words belonging to the @deva[बाह्वादिगण] get the '@deva[इञ्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
41097: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the word @deva[सुधातृ] gets the @deva[इञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] and also the word gets the @deva[अकङ्] @deva[आदेश].
41112: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the words belonging to the @deva[शिवादिगण] get the '@deva[अण्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
41113: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the words that are not @deva[वृद्धसंज्ञक] and represent name of a river or a human female get the '@deva[अण्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
41114: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the words that are names of a @deva[ऋषि], or which belong to the @deva[अन्धक] / @deva[वृष्णि] / @deva[कुरु] family get the '@deva[अण्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
41115: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the words that contain either a @deva[संख्या] , or '@deva[सम्]' or '@deva[भद्र]' as a @deva[पूर्वपद] and  '@deva[मातृ]' as the @deva[उत्तरपद] get the @deva[अण्] @deva[प्रत्यय]. Also, for such words, the @deva[उत्तरपद] @deva[मातृ] gets  @deva[उकारादेश].
41116: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the word @deva[कन्या] gets the '@deva[अण्]' @deva[प्रत्यय] and it also gets '@deva[कानीन]' as @deva[आदेश].
41117:
To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring' - 
1) The word @deva[विकर्ण] when refers to the @deva[वत्सकुल],
2) The word @deva[शुङ्ग] when refers to the @deva[भरद्वाजकुल], and 
3) The word @deva[छगल] when refers to the @deva[अत्रिकुल]
get the @deva[अण्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
41118: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the word @deva[पीला] gets the @deva[अण्-प्रत्यय] optionally.
41119: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the word @deva[मण्डूक] gets the @deva[अण्] as well as @deva[ढक्] @deva[प्रत्यय] optionally.
41120: To indicate the meaning of 'his/her offspring', the @deva[स्त्रीप्रत्ययान्त] words  get the '@deva[ढक्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
42001: To express the meaning of 'colored by', an appropriate @deva[प्रत्यय] gets added to the @deva[तृतीयासमर्थ] word representing the name of the color.
42002: For the word  @deva[लाक्षा], @deva[रोचना], @deva[शकल] and @deva[कर्दम], @deva[ठक्-प्रत्ययः] is used to indicate the meaning of 'colored by'.
42003: To indicate the meaning of 'time occupied by a certain @deva[नक्षत्र]', an appropriate@deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] can be attached to the word in @deva[तृतीया] @deva[विभक्ति]  that indicates name of the @deva[नक्षत्र].
42004: To indicate the meaning of 'time occupied by a certain @deva[नक्षत्र]', an appropriate @deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] which  gets attached to the word in @deva[तृतीया] @deva[विभक्ति] undergoes a @deva[लुप्] if the time being indicated does not have a particular name.
42006: To indicate the meaning of 'time occupied by a certain  @deva[नक्षत्र]', @deva[छ] @deva[प्रत्यय] can be attached to the word in @deva[तृतीया] @deva[विभक्ति] that indicates name of a @deva[नक्षत्रद्वन्द्व].
42007: To indicate the name of a @deva[साम] using its visionary, an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] gets attached to the @deva[तृतीयासमर्थ] name of the visionary.
42008: The word @deva[कलि] gets the @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] '@deva[ढक्]' in the meaning of '@deva[दृष्टं] @deva[साम]'.
42009: The word @deva[वामदेव] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय]s @deva[ड्यत्] and @deva[ड्य] in the meaning of  '@deva[तेन] @deva[दृष्टं] @deva[साम]'.
42010: To represent a @deva[रथ] using a material used to cover it completely, an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] can be attached to the @deva[तृतीयासमर्थ] indicating the covering entity.
42011: The word @deva[पाण्डुकम्बल] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[इनि]' in the meaning of '@deva[परिवृतो] @deva[रथः]'.
42012: The words @deva[द्वैप]  and @deva[वैयाघ्र] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[अञ्] in the meaning of '@deva[परिवृतो] @deva[रथः]'
42014: When a food item is taken out in certain vessel, the food item can be represented by attaching an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] to the name of the vessel occurring in the @deva[सप्तमी] @deva[विभक्ति].
42016: To indicate a food item using the vessel or the medium used for its processing / culturing / preparation, an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] can be used with the word in the @deva[सप्तमी] @deva[विभक्ति] indicating the name of the vessel or the medium.
42017: The words @deva[शूल] and @deva[उखा] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[यत्] in the meaning of @deva[संस्कृतं] @deva[भक्षाः].
42018: The word @deva[दधि] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ठक्] in the meaning of @deva[संस्कृतं] @deva[भक्षाः].
42019: The word  @deva[उदश्वित्] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ठक्]  optionally the meaning of @deva[संस्कृतं] @deva[भक्षाः].
42020: The word @deva[क्षीर] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ढञ्] in the meaning of '@deva[संस्कृतं] @deva[भक्षाः]'
42021: To indicate the name of a month, fortnight or a year based on the name of the full-moon-day falling in it, the @deva[प्रथमासमर्थ] name of the full moon day gets the appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय].
42022: The words @deva[आग्रहायण] and @deva[अश्वत्थ] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ठक्] in the meaning of '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्मिन्] @deva[पौर्णमासी] @deva[इति] @deva[संज्ञायाम्]'.
42023: The words @deva[फाल्गुनी], @deva[श्रवणा], @deva[कार्त्तिकी] and @deva[चैत्री] optionally get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ठक्] in the meaning of  '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्मिन्] @deva[पौर्णमासी] @deva[इति] @deva[संज्ञायाम्]'.
42024: To indicate an entity by referring to its god, an appropriate @deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] can be attached to the @deva[प्रथमासमर्थ] word representing the name of the god.
42025: In the meaning of '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]', the word '@deva[क]' gets the '@deva[इत्]' @deva[आदेश].
42026: The word @deva[शुक्र] gets the @deva[घन्] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the meaning of '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'.
42027: The words '@deva[अपोनप्तात्]' and '@deva[अपान्नप्तात्]'   get the @deva[घ] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the meaning of  @deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता], and they also get converted to '@deva[अपोनप्तृ]' and '@deva[अपान्नप्तृ]' respectively.
42028: The words '@deva[अपोनप्तात्]' and '@deva[अपान्नप्तात्]'   get the @deva[छ-प्रत्यय] in the meaning of  @deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता], and they also get converted to '@deva[अपोनप्तृ]' and '@deva[अपान्नप्तृ]' respectively.
42029: The word '@deva[महेन्द्र]' gets the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] @deva[घ], @deva[छ], and @deva[अण्] in the meaning of  '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'.
42030: The word @deva[सोम] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[ट्यण्]' in the meaning of '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'.
42031: The words '@deva[वायु]', '@deva[ऋतु]', '@deva[पितृ]' and '@deva[उषस्]' get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[यत्] in the meaning of  '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'.
42032: The words @deva[द्यावापृथिवी], @deva[शुनासीर], @deva[मरुत्वत्], @deva[अग्नीषोम], @deva[वास्तोष्पति] and @deva[गृहमेध] get the @deva[यत्] and the @deva[छ] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the meaning of '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'.
42033: The word @deva[अग्नि] gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ढक्] in the meaning of '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'.
42034: For the @deva[कालवाची] words, the same @deva[प्रत्यय] that is provided for the meaning '@deva[तत्र] @deva[भवः]' comes for the meaning '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'  as well.
42035: The words '@deva[महाराज]' and '@deva[प्रोष्ठपद]' get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ठञ्] in the meaning of '@deva[सा] @deva[अस्य] @deva[देवता]'.
42036: The words @deva[पितृव्य], @deva[मातुल], @deva[मातामह] and  @deva[पितामह] are given 'readymade' (that is, without any @deva[प्रक्रिया]).
42037: To indicate the meaning of 'collection / group', a @deva[षष्ठीसमर्थ] word gets an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय].
42039: For the words that indicate a @deva[गोत्र], and for the words in this list - @deva[उक्षन्], @deva[उष्ट्र], @deva[उरभ्र], @deva[राजन्], @deva[राजन्य], @deva[राजपुत्र], @deva[वत्स], @deva[मनुष्य],  @deva[अज] - The @deva[वुञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is added to indicate the meaning of @deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः].
42041: The words @deva[केदार] and @deva[कवचिन्] get the @deva[ठञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'.
42042: The words @deva[ब्राह्मण], @deva[माणव], @deva[वाडव] get the '@deva[यन्]' @deva[प्रत्यय] in the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'.
42043: The words @deva[ग्राम], @deva[जन], @deva[बन्धु], @deva[सहाय] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[तल्] to express the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'
42044: For the words whose first vowel is @deva[अनुदात्त], the @deva[अञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is added in the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'.
42045: The words of the @deva[खण्डिकादिगण] get @deva[अञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] to indicate the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'
42046: For the words that represent the names of stanzas of a poem, the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] that are applicable in the meaning given by the @deva[वार्त्तिक] '@deva[चरणात्] @deva[धर्माम्नानयोः] @deva[इष्यते]' should also be used in the meaning of  '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]' as well.
42047: For the words that represent non-living entities, and also for the words @deva[हस्तिन्] and @deva[धेनु], the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ठक्] is used to indicate the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'.
42048: The word @deva[केश] optionally gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[यञ्] to indicate the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'. The word @deva[अश्व] optionally gets the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[छ] to indicate the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'
42049: The words of @deva[पाशादिगण] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[य]' in the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'
42050: The words @deva[खल], @deva[गो] and @deva[रथ] get the @deva[प्रत्यय]  '@deva[य]' to indicate the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'.
42051: The words @deva[खल], @deva[गो] and @deva[रथ] respectively get the @deva[प्रत्ययाः] - @deva[इनि], @deva[त्र], @deva[कट्यच्] to indicate the meaning of '@deva[तस्य] @deva[समूहः]'.
42052: When the word @deva[विषय] is used to indicate the meaning of @deva[देश] (@deva[ग्रामसमुदाय]), then the @deva[षष्ठीसमर्थ] with which the word @deva[विषय] is associated gets an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय].
42053: The words of the @deva[राजन्यादिगण] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[वुञ्]' in the meaning of '@deva[विषयः] @deva[देशे]'.
42054:
The words of the @deva[भौरिक्यादिगण] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[विधल्]' to indicate the meaning of  '@deva[विषयः] @deva[देशे]'. 
The words of the @deva[ऐषुकार्यादिगण] get the @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[भक्तल्]' to indicate the meaning of  '@deva[विषयः] @deva[देशे]'.
42055: To indicate a @deva[प्रगाथ] using the @deva[छन्द] of the first stanza of that @deva[प्रगाथ], an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] can be attached to the @deva[प्रथमासमर्थ] representing the name of the @deva[छन्द].
42056: To indicate a battle using the purpose or the participants of that battle, an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] can be attached to the word in the @deva[प्रथमा] @deva[विभक्ति] which represents the purpose or the participants of the battle.
42057: To indicate a sport using an entity used for hitting in that sport, an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] gets attached to the @deva[प्रथमासमर्थ] word indicating the name of the entity used for hitting.
42067: To indicate the name of a country by referring to the entities present in that country, an appropriate @deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] gets attached to the word in @deva[प्रथमाविभक्ति] representing the name of that entity.
42068: To indicate the name of a country by referring to its creator, an appropriate @deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] gets attached to the word in @deva[तृतीयाविभक्ति] representing the name of the creator.
42069: To indicate the name of a country by referring to its residents, an appropriate @deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] gets attached to the word in @deva[षष्ठीविभक्ति] representing the name of the residents.
42070: To indicate the name of a country by referring to the another country that is near it, an appropriate @deva[तद्धित] @deva[प्रत्यय] gets attached to the word in @deva[षष्ठीविभक्ति] representing the name of the country that is nearby.
42071: The @deva[उवर्णान्त] @deva[प्रातिपदिक]s get the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[अञ्] in the context of @deva[चतुरर्थाः].
42072: For the word that ends in a @deva[मतुप्-प्रत्यय] and has three or more @deva[स्वराः] in the @deva[अङ्ग] to which the  @deva[मतुप्-प्रत्यय] is attached, the @deva[अञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used in the context of @deva[चतुरर्थाः].
42073: In the context of @deva[चतुरर्थाः], to indicate the name of a well by referring to a word that has three or more @deva[स्वराः] , @deva[अञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used.
42074: In the context of @deva[चतुरर्थाः], to indicate the name of a well by referring to a word having one or two @deva[स्वराः],  @deva[अञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used if the well exists in the northern region of the river @deva[विपाश्] .
42075: In the context of @deva[चतुरर्थाः], the words belonging to the @deva[सङ्कलादिगण] get the @deva[अञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
42076: In the context of  @deva[चतुरर्थाः],  To indicate the feminine name of a country in the @deva[सौवीर] region, @deva[शाल्व] region or eastern region, the @deva[अञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय]  is used.
42077: In the context of @deva[चतुरर्थाः],  the words of the @deva[सुवास्तुगण] get the @deva[अण्]  @deva[प्रत्यय].
42078: In the context of @deva[चतुरर्थाः],  the words ending in '@deva[रोणी]' get the '@deva[अण्]' @deva[प्रत्यय].
43023: The words @deva[सायम्], @deva[चिरम्], @deva[प्रगे], @deva[प्राह्णे], and all the @deva[कालवाचक-अव्ययानि] get the @deva[ट्यु] and @deva[ट्युल्] @deva[प्रत्यय] in the @deva[शैषिक]-meanings. Also, the @deva[ट्यु] and @deva[ट्युल्] @deva[प्रत्यय] get a @deva[तुट्] @deva[आगम] in this context.
44001: The @deva[ठक्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used as a default for the @deva[प्राग्वहतीय] meanings.
44002: The @deva[ठक्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is attached to a @deva[तृतीयासमर्थ] instrument to indicate  (1) a person who gambles, (2) A person who digs, (3) A person who wins, (4) An entity that is won.
44003: To express an entity that has been cultured / processed, an appropriate @deva[तद्धितप्रत्यय] gets attached to the @deva[तृतीयासमर्थ] word indicating the substance used for culturing / processing.
44075: The @deva[यत्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used as a default for the @deva[प्राक्-हितीय] meanings.
51001: The @deva[छ] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used as a default for the @deva[प्राक्-क्रीतीय] meanings.
51018: The @deva[ठञ्] @deva[प्रत्यय] is used as a default for the @deva[प्राग्वतीय] meanings.
52047: When the cost of 'one unit' of an entity is to be expressed in terms of the cost of 'multiple units' of another entity, @deva[मयट्] @deva[प्रत्यय] can be applied to the number that represents the 'number of units' of the second entity.
53071: For an @deva[अव्यय], a @deva[सर्वनामशब्द] and  a @deva[तिङ्गन्त] word the @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[अकच्]' comes just before the '@deva[टि]'@deva[संज्ञक] component of that word under  all the @deva[प्राग्-इवीय] meanings.
61001: In this @deva[अधिकार] the doubling happens for the first @deva[एकाच्] entity of the verb
61002: The @deva[द्वित्व] mandated in the <<@deva[एकाचो] @deva[द्वे] @deva[प्रथमस्य]>> @ref[6.1.1] @deva[अधिकार] happens for the second @deva[एकाच्] component of an @deva[अनेकाच्] @deva[अजादि] word.
61003: When doubling of an @deva[अनेकाच्] @deva[अजादि]  verb root is to be done, the @deva[नकार], @deva[दकार], and @deva[रेफ] present at the beginning of a @deva[संयोग] are not duplicated.
61004: When a repetition is done, the first entity out of the two is called @deva[अभ्यास].
61005: When the doubling happens in this @deva[अधिकार], the two copies are collectively referred as '@deva[अभ्यस्त]'.
61006: The verb roots belonging to the @deva[जक्षित्यादिगण] are called '@deva[अभ्यस्त]'.
61008: When followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[लिट्] @deva[लकार],  a verb root that have not yet undergone @deva[द्वित्वम्] undergoes @deva[द्वित्वम्].
61009: When followed by the @deva[सन्-प्रत्यय] or the  @deva[यङ्-प्रत्यय], a verb root that have not yet undergone @deva[द्वित्वम्] undergoes @deva[द्वित्वम्].
61010: When a @deva[प्रत्यय] is removed using the word @deva[श्लु], @deva[अङ्ग] which is not yet duplicated is duplicated.
61011: When followed by the @deva[चङ्-प्रत्यय], a verb root that have not yet undergone @deva[द्वित्वम्] undergoes @deva[द्वित्वम्].
61063: The @deva[आदेशा]s @deva[पद्],@deva[दत्],@deva[नस्], @deva[मास्], @deva[हृत्], @deva[निश्], @deva[असन्], @deva[यूषन्], @deva[दोषन्], @deva[यकन्], @deva[शकन्], @deva[उदन्], @deva[आसन्] are created (to the appropriate words) in presence @deva[शस्] and other @deva[विभक्ति]s from @deva[तृतीया] onwards.
61064: A @deva[षकार] present at the beginning of @deva[औपदेशिक]  form of a @deva[धातु] is converted to @deva[सकार].
61065: A @deva[णकार] present at the beginning of @deva[औपदेशिक] form of a @deva[धातु] is converted to @deva[नकार].
61066: A @deva[वकार] and a @deva[यकार] are deleted when followed by a letter of the @deva[वल्] @deva[प्रत्याहार].
61067: The @deva[प्रत्यय] '@deva[वि]' is removed when it appears @deva[अपृक्त].
61068: The @deva[सुँ], @deva[ति], or @deva[सि] @deva[प्रत्यय], when present as a single letter, is removed when attached to - (1) a word ending in a  @deva[हल्] letter,  or (2) A @deva[दीर्घ] word ending in the  @deva[ङीप्] / @deva[ङीष्] / @deva[ङीन्] / @deva[चाप्] / @deva[टाप्] / @deva[डाप्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
61069: The @deva[हल्] letter that belongs to a @deva[सम्बुद्धिप्रत्यय] attached to @deva[एङन्त] or @deva[ह्रस्वान्त] word is removed.
61070: In @deva[वेदाः], '@deva[शि]' is seen removed at some places.
61071: A @deva[ह्रस्व] letter that is followed by a @deva[कृत्-प्रत्यय] that is @deva[पित्] gets a @deva[तुगागम].
61072: This is an @deva[अधिकार] that runs till <<@deva[पारस्करप्रभृतीनि] @deva[च] @deva[संज्ञायाम्]>> @ref[6.1.157]. Anything told in this @deva[अधिकार] happens only in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61073: A @deva[ह्रस्व] @deva[स्वर] gets a @deva[तुक्-आगमः] when followed by a @deva[छकार], in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61074: The words @deva[आङ्] and @deva[माङ्] get a @deva[तुक्-आगम] when followed by a @deva[छकार], in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61075: A @deva[दीर्घ] @deva[स्वर] gets a @deva[तुक्-आगमः] when followed by a @deva[छकार],  in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61076: A @deva[दीर्घ] @deva[स्वर] at end of a @deva[पद] gets optional @deva[तुक्-आगमः] when followed by a @deva[छकार],  in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61077: An @deva[इक्] letter which is followed by a @deva[स्वर] is converted to a corresponding @deva[यण्] letter in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61078: When followed by a @deva[स्वर], the letters of the @deva[एच्] @deva[प्रत्याहार] are respectively converted to @deva[अय्], @deva[अव्], @deva[आय्] and @deva[आव्] in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61079: An @deva[ओकार] and an @deva[औकार] are respectively converted to @deva[अव्] and @deva[आव्] when followed by a @deva[यकारादि] @deva[प्रत्यय], in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61080: In the context of @deva[संहिता], the @deva[ओकार]/@deva[औकार] at the end of a @deva[धातु], when followed by @deva[यकारादि-प्रत्यय], is converted to @deva[अव्] / @deva[आव्]  only if that @deva[ओकार]/@deva[औकार] is generated by that @deva[यकारादिप्रत्यय] itself.
61081: The words @deva[क्षय्य] and @deva[जय्य] are considered to be derived, in the meaning of (respectively) 'the one that is capable of being destroyed' and 'the one that is capable of being won over'.
61082: The words @deva[क्रय्य] is considered to be derived, in the meaning of 'the one that can be purchased'.
61083: In the context of Vedas, the words @deva[भय्य] (the one from which somebody is afraid) and the word @deva[प्रवय्या] (= a female being impregnated) are seen used (and should thus be considered derived).
61084: This is an @deva[अधिकार] that runs till <<@deva[ऋतः] @deva[उत्]>> @ref[6.1.111]. Any @deva[आदेश] told in this @deva[अधिकार] should be understood as combined @deva[आदेश] done on the participating entities.
61085: The @deva[एकादेश] told in the @deva[एकः] @deva[पूर्वपरयोः] @deva[अधिकार] acts like the last letter of the @deva[पूर्वशब्द] as well as the first letter of the @deva[परशब्द].
61086: The @deva[एकादेश] mentioned under the @deva[एकः] @deva[पूर्वपरयोः] @deva[अधिकार] should be considered @deva[असिद्ध] while doing @deva[षत्वम्] or a @deva[तुक्] @deva[आगम].
61087: When an @deva[अवर्ण] is followed by an @deva[अच्] letter in the context of @deva[संहिता], both of them are replaced by a single @deva[गुण] letter
61088: When an @deva[अवर्ण] is followed by an @deva[एच्] letter in the context of @deva[संहिता], both of them are replaced by a single @deva[वृद्धि] letter.
61089: In the context of @deva[संहिता], When an @deva[अवर्ण] followed by the @deva[एच्] letter of the @deva[इण्] @deva[धातु] or @deva[एध्] @deva[धातु], or the word @deva[ऊठ्] ; both of them are replaced by a single @deva[वृद्धि] letter.
61090: When the @deva[आट्-आगम] is followed by a @deva[अच्]-letter,  both of them are replaced by a single @deva[वृद्धि] letter.
61091: When an @deva[अवर्णान्त] @deva[उपसर्ग] is followed by a  @deva[ऋकारादि] verb form,  both of them are replaced by a single @deva[वृद्धि] letter.
61092: When an @deva[अवर्णान्त] @deva[उपसर्ग] is followed by a @deva[ऋकारादि] @deva[सुब्धातु], both of them are optionally replaced by a single @deva[वृद्धि] letter.
61093: When an @deva[ओकार]  is followed by the @deva[अम्-प्रत्यय] or the @deva[शस्-प्रत्यय],  both the letters are replaced by single @deva[आकार].
61094: When an @deva[अवर्णान्त] @deva[उपसर्ग] is followed by a @deva[एकारादि] or @deva[ओकारादि] verb form, both the letters are replaced by a single @deva[पररूप].
61095: In the context of @deva[संहिता], When @deva[अवर्ण] is followed by the word @deva[ओम्] or the word @deva[आङ्] , both the letters are replaced by a single @deva[पररूप].
61096: In the context of @deva[संहिता], @deva[ऌ]hen a @deva[अवर्ण] not occurring at end of a @deva[पद] is followed by the word '@deva[उस्]', both of them are replaced by a single @deva[पररूप].
61097: In the context of @deva[संहिता], when an @deva[अपदान्त] @deva[अकार] is followed by a @deva[गुण] letter, both of them are replaced by a single @deva[पररूप].
61098: In the context of @deva[संहिता], When a word which is used to imitate some abstract sound and which ends is the phrase '@deva[अत्]' is followed by the word '@deva[इति]', then the '@deva[अत्]' of the previous word and the @deva[इ] of @deva[इति] are combined to form a @deva[पररूप-एकादेश].
61099: When a word which is used to imitate some abstract sound and which ends is the phrase '@deva[अत्]' and which is also an @deva[आम्रेडितसंज्ञक] is followed by the word '@deva[इति]', then the '@deva[अत्]' of the previous word and the @deva[इ] of @deva[इति] are not combined as mentioned in the previous rule '@deva[अव्यक्तानुकरणस्यात] @deva[इतौ]'. Instead, the @deva[त्] and @deva[इ] optionally combine to form a @deva[पररूप-एकादेश].
61101: In the context of @deva[संहिता], when an @deva[अक्] letter is followed by a @deva[सवर्ण] @deva[अच्] letter, both of them are replaced by a @deva[दीर्घ-एकादेश].
61102: When a letter from the  @deva[अक्] @deva[प्रत्याहार] is followed by an @deva[अजादि] @deva[प्रत्यय] of  @deva[प्रथमा] or @deva[द्वितीया] @deva[विभक्ति], then @deva[पूर्व] and the @deva[पर] letters are replaced by a single @deva[पूर्वसवर्णदीर्घ].
61103: When the rule '@deva[प्रथमयोः] @deva[पूर्वसवर्णः]' is used to create a @deva[पूर्वसवर्णदीर्घ] for a @deva[पुंलिङ्ग] word in presence of the @deva[शस्-प्रत्यय], then the @deva[सकार] of the @deva[शस्-प्रत्यय] is converted to @deva[नकार].
61104: When @deva[अकार] / @deva[आकार] is followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[प्रथमा] or @deva[द्वितीया] @deva[विभक्ति] that begins with a letter of @deva[इच्-प्रत्याहार], then the @deva[पूर्वसवर्णदीर्घ] given by '@deva[प्रथमयोः] @deva[पूर्वसवर्णः]' does not happen.
61105: When @deva[दीर्घस्वर] is followed by either the @deva[जस्-प्रत्यय], or a @deva[प्रत्यय] of @deva[प्रथमा] or @deva[द्वितीया] @deva[विभक्ति] that begins with a letter of @deva[इच्-प्रत्याहार], then the @deva[पूर्वसवर्णदीर्घ] mandated by '@deva[प्रथमयोः] @deva[पूर्वसवर्णः]' does not happen.
61106: The @deva[पूर्वसवर्णदीर्घनिषेध] given by the sutra '@deva[दीर्घाज्जसि] @deva[च]' is optional while deriving the Vedic forms.
61107: When a letter from the @deva[अक्] @deva[प्रत्याहार] is followed @deva[अकार] of the @deva[अम्-प्रत्यय], both the letters are combined to form a @deva[पूर्वरूप-एकादेश].
61108: When a letter having the sanjna @deva[सम्प्रसारण] is followed by an @deva[अच्] letter, both of them are combined to form a @deva[पूर्वरूप-एकादेश].
61109: If a @deva[पदान्त] @deva[ए] / @deva[ओ] letter is followed by a @deva[ह्रस्व] @deva[अकार], then both of them combine to form a @deva[पूर्वरूप] @deva[एकादेश].
61110: If an @deva[एकार] or @deva[ओकार] is followed by the @deva[अकार] of @deva[ङसिँ] or @deva[ङस्] @deva[प्रत्यय],  then both of them combined to form a @deva[पूर्वरूप] @deva[एकादेश].
61111: If a @deva[ऋकार] or @deva[ऌकार] is followed by the @deva[अकार] of  @deva[ङसिँ] or @deva[ङस्] @deva[प्रत्यय],  then both of them combined to form an @deva[उकार].
61112: The @deva[अकार] of the  @deva[ङसिँ]/@deva[ङस्] @deva[प्रत्यय] following a '@deva[ख्य्]' / '@deva[त्य्]' is converted to @deva[उकार].
61113: A @deva[रुँ] letter that is sandwiched between an @deva[अप्लुत-ह्रस्व-अकार] from each side is converted to an @deva[उकार].
61114: A @deva[रुँ] letter that follows an @deva[अप्लुत-ह्रस्व-अकार] and is followed by a @deva[हश्] letter is converted to an @deva[उकार].
61122: In the context of @deva[संहिता], an @deva[ओकार] occurring at the end of the @deva[पदसंज्ञक] @deva[गो] @deva[शब्द] exhibits optional @deva[प्रकृतिभाव] when followed by a @deva[ह्रस्व] @deva[अकार].
61123: In the context of @deva[संहिता], The @deva[पदसंज्ञक] @deva[गो] word when followed by a @deva[स्वर] gets an @deva[अवङ्] @deva[आदेश] optionally.
61124: In the context of @deva[संहिता], The word @deva[गो] when followed by the word @deva[इन्द्र] gets the @deva[अवङ्-आदेश].
61125: @deva[प्लुत] letters and @deva[प्रगृह्य] words do not undergo a @deva[सन्धि] when followed by an @deva[अच्]-letter, even when there is @deva[संहिता].
61126: In the context of @deva[संहिता] and in the derivation of the @deva[वैदिक] forms, when @deva[आङ्] is followed by an @deva[अच्] letter, @deva[आङ्] becomes @deva[अनुनासिक] and does not undergo sandhi with the @deva[अच्] letter.
61127: According to @deva[शाकल्य], In the context of @deva[संहिता] a @deva[पदान्त-इक्]-letter, when followed by an @deva[असवर्ण] @deva[अच्]-letter undergoes @deva[ह्रस्वादेशः] and then no other sandhi happens.
61128: According to @deva[शाकल्य], In the context of @deva[संहिता] a @deva[पदान्त-अक्]-letter, when followed by a @deva[ह्रस्व] @deva[ऋ]/@deva[ऌ]-letter undergoes @deva[ह्रस्वादेशः] and then no other sandhi happens.
61129: When followed by an @deva[अवैदिक] '@deva[इति]' word, a @deva[प्लुत] behaves as if it is not @deva[प्लुत] in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61130: According to @deva[चाक्रवर्मण], the @deva[प्लुतः] @deva[ईकारः] behaves as if it is not @deva[प्लुत] when followed by an @deva[अच्]-letter in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61131: The '@deva[दिव्]' word that is a @deva[पद] also gets the @deva[उत्-आदेश].
61132: Except for the @deva[नञ्] @deva[समास], when a form of @deva[एतद्]/@deva[तद्] word which does not contain a @deva[ककार] is followed by a  @deva[सुँ-प्रत्यय] which in turn is followed by a @deva[व्यञ्जन]. the @deva[सुँ-प्रत्यय] gets removed in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61133: In the derivation of the Vedic words, the @deva[सुँ-प्रत्यय] attached to the @deva[प्रथमा-एकवचन] of the word @deva[त्यद्] might or might not be removed when followed by a @deva[हल्] in the context of @deva[संहिता].
61134: The @deva[सुँ-प्रत्यय] of @deva[सः] gets removed when followed by an @deva[अच्], provided that (only) by doing so, the @deva[पाद] can be completed.
61164: The word ending in a @deva[तद्धितसंज्ञक] @deva[चित्-प्रत्यय] become @deva[अन्तोदात्त].
61165: The word ending in a @deva[तद्धितसंज्ञक] @deva[कित्-प्रत्यय] become @deva[अन्तोदात्त].
61193: For the @deva[प्रकृति-प्रत्यय-समुदाय] that ends in a @deva[लित्-प्रत्यय], the @deva[स्वर] that comes before the @deva[प्रत्यय] becomes @deva[उदात्त].
61197: The word ending in a @deva[ञित्] or a @deva[नित्] @deva[प्रत्यय] become @deva[आद्युदात्त].
61217: The second last  @deva[स्वर] of the @deva[प्रकृति-प्रत्यय-समुदाय] that ends in a @deva[रित्] @deva[प्रत्यय] becomes @deva[उदात्त].
63047: The words @deva[द्वि] and @deva[अष्टन्] get an @deva[आकारादेश] in presence of a  @deva[सङ्ख्याशब्द], provided that there is no @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] and the word @deva[अशीति] is not present.
63048: The words @deva[त्रि] gets an @deva[आकारादेश] in presence of a  @deva[सङ्ख्याशब्द], provided that there is no @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] and the word @deva[अशीति] is not present.
63093: If the '@deva[सम्]' @deva[उपसर्ग] is followed by an @deva[लुप्तप्रत्ययान्त-अञ्च्] word, then '@deva[सम्]'  is converted to '@deva[समि]'.
63094: If the word '@deva[तिरस्]' is followed by a  @deva[लुप्तप्रत्ययान्त-अञ्च्] word from which an @deva[अकार] has not been removed, then the word '@deva[तिरस्]' is converted to '@deva[तिरि]'.
63095: If the word '@deva[सह]' is followed by an @deva[लुप्तप्रत्ययान्त-अञ्च्] word, then '@deva[सह]'  is converted to '@deva[सध्रि]'.
63110: When the word @deva[अह्न] appears as an @deva[उत्तरपद] in a @deva[समास] where the @deva[पूर्वपद] is either a number, or the words @deva[वि] or @deva[साय], it is optionally converted to @deva[अहन्] in presence of the @deva[प्रत्यय] @deva[ङि].
63111: When a @deva[ढकार] is deleted due to a @deva[ढकार] that follows it, or when a @deva[रेफ] is deleted due to a @deva[रेफ] that follows the @deva[अण्] letter occurring before the deleted @deva[ढकार]/@deva[रेफ] becomes @deva[दीर्घ].
63112: For the verbs @deva[सह्] and @deva[वह्], when a @deva[ढकार] is deleted due to a @deva[ढकार] that follows it,  the @deva[अकार] occurring before the deleted @deva[ढकार] is converted to @deva[ओ].
63138: When the @deva[अञ्च्] word is in a state where its @deva[अकार] and @deva[नकार] have been removed, it causes the @deva[दीर्घ] of the previous @deva[अण्] letter.
64001: In all the rules starting from this sutra till the end of the seventh chapter the word '@deva[अङ्गस्य]' should be included while interpreting the sutras.
64002: The letter which has been generated using @deva[सम्प्रसारणम्] and which occurs at end of an @deva[अङ्ग] becomes @deva[दीर्घ] when there is a @deva[हल्] letter which occurs just before it in that @deva[अङ्ग].
64003: In presence of the   @deva[नाम्] @deva[प्रत्यय], the last letter of the @deva[अङ्ग] becomes @deva[दीर्घ].
64004: The words @deva[तिसृ] and @deva[चतसृ] do not become @deva[दीर्घ] in presence of the  @deva[नाम्] @deva[प्रत्यय].
64005: In presence of the @deva[नाम्] @deva[प्रत्यय], the last letter of the @deva[अङ्ग] might or might not be made @deva[दीर्घ] in @deva[वेदाः].
64006: In presence of the @deva[नाम्] @deva[प्रत्यय], the last letter of the word @deva[नृ] becomes @deva[दीर्घ] optionally.
64007: The @deva[उपधा] of the @deva[नकारान्त] words becomes @deva[दीर्घ] when the @deva[नकारान्त] word is followed by the @deva[नाम्-प्रत्यय].
64008: The  @deva[उपधा] letter of a @deva[नकारान्त] @deva[अङ्ग] becomes @deva[दीर्घ] when followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] which is a @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] other than @deva[सम्बोधन-एकवचन].
64009: When followed by a @deva[प्रत्यय] which is a @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] other than @deva[सम्बोधन-एकवचन], the @deva[उपधा] @deva[स्वर] of a @deva[नकारान्त] @deva[अङ्ग] becomes optionally @deva[दीर्घ] in @deva[वेदाः], if that @deva[उपधा] @deva[स्वर] is preceded by a @deva[षकार].
64010:
The @deva[स्वर] preceding the @deva[नकार] from (a) @deva[महत्] and (b) any word that ends in @deva[न्स्] - becomes @deva[दीर्घ] in presence of 
@deva[प्रत्यय] that is also a @deva[सर्वनामस्थान], other than @deva[सम्बोधन-एकवचन].
64011: The @deva[उपधा] letter of the words @deva[अप्], @deva[स्वसृ], @deva[नप्तृ], @deva[नेष्टृ], @deva[त्वष्टृ], @deva[क्षत्तृ], @deva[होतृ], @deva[पोतृ], and @deva[प्रशातृ], and also of the words ending in a @deva[तृन्] or @deva[तृच्] @deva[प्रत्यय] becomes @deva[दीर्घ] in presence of a @deva[प्रत्यय] that is also a @deva[सर्वनामस्थान], other than @deva[सम्बोधन-एकवचन].
64012: For the words @deva[हन्], @deva[पूषन्] and @deva[अर्यमन्], and for also the words that end in '@deva[इन्]', the @deva[उपधादीर्घ] happens only in case of the '@deva[शि]' @deva[प्रत्यय], and not in case of other @deva[सर्वनामस्थानप्रत्ययाः].
64013: For the words @deva[हन्], @deva[पूषन्] and @deva[अर्यमन्], and for also the words that end in '@deva[इन्]', the @deva[उपधादीर्घ] happens in case of the @deva[सुँ-प्रत्यय] of @deva[प्रथमा-एकवचन].
64014: The @deva[उपधा] of the words ending in either @deva[मत्], @deva[वत्], or @deva[अस्] becomes @deva[दीर्घ] in presence of the @deva[सुँ-प्रत्यय] of  @deva[प्रथमा] @deva[एकवचन], provided these words do not end in a @deva[धातु].
64015: If an @deva[अङ्ग] ends in an @deva[अनुनासिक], the @deva[उपधा] letter of that @deva[अङ्ग]  becomes @deva[दीर्घ] in presence of a @deva[क्विप्-प्रत्यय], @deva[झलादि-कित्-प्रत्यय] and a @deva[झलादि-ङित्-प्रत्यय].
64018: The @deva[उपधा] letter of the verb-root '@deva[क्रम्]' undergoes an optional @deva[दीर्घादेश] when followed by a @deva[झलादि] @deva[क्त्वा] @deva[प्रत्यय].
64019: The last '@deva[त्छ्]' of an @deva[अङ्ग] is converted to '@deva[श्]', and the last '@deva[व्]' of an @deva[अङ्ग] is converted to '@deva[ऊठ्]' when followed by an @deva[अनुनासिकादि] or @deva[झलादि] @deva[प्रत्यय] that is either @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] ।
